me.tatarka.ipromise

Class Deferred<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.tatarka.ipromise.Deferred<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of a result

    public class Deferred<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A Deferred is the producer end of a Promise. An asynchronous method creates a Deferred and returns promise(), then calls resolve(Object) at a later time.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Deferred.Builder
      A builder to configure and construct multiple deferreds.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Deferred

        public Deferred()
        Constructs a new Deferred.

      • Deferred

        public Deferred(CancelToken cancelToken)
        Constructs a new Deferred with the given CancelToken. When the token is canceled, this deferred's Promise is also canceled.
        Parameters:
        cancelToken - the cancel token

      • Deferred

        public Deferred(PromiseBuffer<T> buffer)
        Constructs a new Deferred with the given PromiseBuffer. The deferred's Promise will use the given buffer to buffer messages and redeliver them when a Listener is attached.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the promise buffer

      • Deferred

        public Deferred(PromiseBuffer<T> buffer,
                CancelToken cancelToken)
        Constructs a new Deferred with the given PromiseBuffer and CancelToken. The deferred's Promise will use the given buffer to buffer messages and redeliver them when a Listener is attached. When the token is canceled, this deferred's Promise is also canceled.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the promise buffer
        cancelToken - the cancel token

      • Deferred

        public Deferred(int bufferType)
        Constructs a new Deferred with the given PromiseBuffer type. Valid values are Promise.BUFFER_NONE, Promise.BUFFER_LAST, and Promise.BUFFER_ALL. The deferred's Promise will use the given buffer to buffer messages and redeliver them when a Listener is attached.
        Parameters:
        bufferType - the promise buffer

      • Deferred

        public Deferred(int bufferType,
                CancelToken cancelToken)
        Constructs a new Deferred with the given PromiseBuffer type and CancelToken. Valid values for the buffer are Promise.BUFFER_NONE, Promise.BUFFER_LAST, and Promise.BUFFER_ALL. The deferred's Promise will use the given buffer to buffer messages and redeliver them when a Listener is attached. When the token is canceled, this deferred's Promise is also canceled.
        Parameters:
        bufferType - the promise buffer
        cancelToken - the cancel token

      • Deferred

        public Deferred(PromiseBuffer<T> buffer,
                CancelToken cancelToken,
                java.util.concurrent.Executor callbackExecutor)
        Constructs a new Deferred with the given PromiseBuffer, CancelToken, and callback executor. The deferred's Promise will use the given buffer to buffer messages and redeliver them when a Listener is attached. When the token is canceled, this deferred's Promise is also canceled. The callback executor is used to run the Promise.listen(Listener) and Promise.onClose(CloseListener) callbacks. The default is to run callbacks on a single background thread. See CallbackExecutors for more details.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the promise buffer
        cancelToken - the cancel token
        callbackExecutor - the callback executor
        See Also:
        CallbackExecutors

        Throws:

      • resolve

        public Deferred<T> resolve(T message)
        Sends a message to the Promise and immediately closes it. This is useful if you only have one message to send.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to send
        Returns:
        the Deferred for chaining
        Throws:
        Promise.AlreadyClosedException - thrown if the promise as already been closed

      • resolveAll

        public Deferred<T> resolveAll(java.lang.Iterable<T> messages)
        Sends all of the messages to the Promise and immediately closes it. This is useful if you only have no more messages to send.
        Parameters:
        messages - the messages to send
        Returns:
        the Deferred for chaining
        Throws:
        Promise.AlreadyClosedException - thrown if the promise as already been closed

      • resolveAll

        public Deferred<T> resolveAll(T... messages)
        Sends all of the messages to the Promise and immediately closes it. This is useful if you only have no more messages to send.
        Parameters:
        messages - the messages to send
        Returns:
        the Deferred for chaining
        Throws:
        Promise.AlreadyClosedException - thrown if the promise as already been closed

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the Promise. After this, no more messages can be sent. This must be called when you don't have any more message to send.
